meanings.definition: A rule that is subordinate to another rule.
meanings.sent1: The subrule stated that all employees must wear a uniform.
meanings.sent2: The company handbook included a subrule about break times.
meanings.sent3: The subrule requiring everyone to wear a hat on Fridays was a bit silly.
meanings.sent4: The subrule on using only blue ink was a strict guideline.
meanings.sent5: The subrule about no talking during meetings was easy to remember.

meanings.definition: To establish a rule that is subordinate to another rule.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to subrule that all reports must be submitted by Friday.
meanings.sent2: She subruled that all team members must attend the training session.
meanings.sent3: He subruled that everyone must bring a plant to work on Mondays for good luck.
meanings.sent4: The teacher subruled that all homework must be completed in pencil.
meanings.sent5: The coach subruled that all players must arrive 30 minutes early for practice.
